bytebase.store.ApprovalFlow.schema.stric.description: ApprovalFlow defines the sequence of approvals required.

roles.description: List of role names that must approve, in order.

bytebase.store.ApprovalFlow.schema.stric.title: Approval Flow

bytebase.store.ApprovalTemplate.schema.s.description: ApprovalTemplate defines the approval workflow and requirements for an issue.

description.description: Detailed description of when this template applies.

title.description: Human-readable title of the approval template.

bytebase.store.ApprovalTemplate.schema.s.title: Approval Template

bytebase.store.GrantRequest.schema.stric.description: GrantRequest contains details for requesting database access permissions.

condition.description: Optional conditional expression that limits when the grant applies.

expiration.description: Duration after which the grant automatically expires.

role.description:
The role being requested for the user.
 Format: roles/EXPORTER.

user.description:
The user who will receive the role.
 Format: users/{userUID}.

bytebase.store.GrantRequest.schema.stric.title: Grant Request

bytebase.store.Issue.schema.strict.json.description: Issue is the metadata for issues that track database operations and access requests.

approval.description: Approval information for the issue workflow.

grant_request.description: Access grant request details if this is a grant request issue.

labels.description: Labels attached to categorize and filter the issue.

risk_level.description: Risk level for the issue, calculated from statement types.
risk_level.title: Risk Level

bytebase.store.Issue.schema.strict.json.title: Issue

bytebase.store.IssuePayloadApproval.Appr.description: Approver represents a user who can approve or reject an issue.

principal_id.description: The ID of the principal who is the approver.

bytebase.store.IssuePayloadApproval.Appr.title: Approver

bytebase.store.IssuePayloadApproval.sche.description: IssuePayloadApproval records the approval template used and approval history for an issue.

approval_finding_done.description:
Whether the system has finished finding a matching approval template.
 False means the backend is still searching for matching templates.

approval_finding_error.description: Error message if approval template finding failed.

approval_template.description: The approval template being used for this issue.

approvers.description: List of approvers and their current status.

bytebase.store.IssuePayloadApproval.sche.title: Issue Payload Approval

google.type.Expr.schema.strict.json.description:
Example (Comparison):

     title: "Summary size limit"
     description: "Determines if a summary is less than 100 chars"
     expression: "document.summary.size() < 100"

 Example (Equality):

     title: "Requestor is owner"
     description: "Determines if requestor is the document owner"
     expression: "document.owner == request.auth.claims.email"

 Example (Logic):

     title: "Public documents"
     description: "Determine whether the document should be publicly visible"
     expression: "document.type != 'private' && document.type != 'internal'"

 Example (Data Manipulation):

     title: "Notification string"
     description: "Create a notification string with a timestamp."
     expression: "'New message received at ' + string(document.create_time)"

 The exact variables and functions that may be referenced within an expression
 are determined by the service that evaluates it. See the service
 documentation for additional information.

description.description:
Optional. Description of the expression. This is a longer text which
 describes the expression, e.g. when hovered over it in a UI.

expression.description:
Textual representation of an expression in Common Expression Language
 syntax.

location.description:
Optional. String indicating the location of the expression for error
 reporting, e.g. a file name and a position in the file.

title.description:
Optional. Title for the expression, i.e. a short string describing
 its purpose. This can be used e.g. in UIs which allow to enter the
 expression.

google.type.Expr.schema.strict.json.title:
Represents a textual expression in the Common Expression Language (CEL)
 syntax. CEL is a C-like expression language. The syntax and semantics of CEL
 are documented at https://github.com/google/cel-spec.
